alert.note: Alert for Oahu in Honolulu (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 29 at 5:31AM HST until April 29 at 8:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM HST THIS MORNING FOR THE ISLAND OF OAHU IN HONOLULU COUNTY... At 531 AM HST, local law enforcement reported heavy rain over windward Oahu. Rain was falling at a rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour. Flash flooding is ongoing and Kamehameha Highway has been closed in both directions due to water over the road between 48-279 Kamehameha Highway and Waikane Valley Road. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Law enforcement. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Waikane, Waiahole, Kahaluu, Kaaawa, Ahuimanu, Punaluu, Pearl City, Mililani, Aiea, Hauula, Wahiawa, Halawa, Moanalua, Kaneohe, Salt Lake, Laie, Kaneohe Marine Base, Kalihi, Maunawili and Kahuku. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown.
